fieldDescription:
Percentage chance that an officer will be injured.
An officer has to be fatigued before they will be injured.
The base duration of injuries before randomisation.

The maximum amount injury base duration will be increased or decreased by.
Thus, the duration of all injuries is randomly and evenly distributed in the interval:
(Injury Base Duration - Injury Duration Variation) <= Injury Duration <= (Injury Base Duration + Injury Duration Variation)

Percentage chance that the duration of an existing injury (if it exists) on an officer will be increased, if there are no skills left to remove from an officer instead of inflicting the officer with a Grave Injury.

Percentage chance that an officer will be fatigued after exhausting activities, like combat.
By default, officers are _always_ fatigued after combat.
The base duration of fatigue before randomisation.

The maximum amount fatigue base duration will be increased or decreased by.
Thus, the duration of all injuries is randomly and evenly distributed in the interval:
(Fatigue Base Duration - Fatigue Duration Variation) <= Fatigue Duration <= (Fatigue Base Duration + Fatigue Duration Variation)
Percentage chance that an officer will be fatigued for longer instead of being injured, if they are already fatigued when engaging in an exhausting activity.
Toggle to disable or re-enable the fatigue mechanic
